title: 112_hr3320
content: The Act may be cited as the "Compact-Impact Reimbursement Act of 2011" and includes findings and purpose. The "Compact-Impact Reimbursement Act of 2011" acknowledges the adverse consequences for Guam, American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and Hawaii due to migration from the Freely Associated States. Congress is committed to addressing these impacts sympathetically and expeditiously. The Compact-Impact Reimbursement Act of 2011 addresses the adverse financial consequences faced by Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and Hawaii due to increased demands on health, educational, and social services from individuals of the Freely Associated States. The Act aims to meet the obligations set forth in the Compact to alleviate the unfunded mandate. SEC. 3. Ensuring mandatory appropriations and health services reimbursement as part of Compact-Impact aid. Section 104(e)(6) of the Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 is amended to provide $185,000,000 annually from 2012 to 2024 for grants to Guam, Hawaii, Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa to help cover costs from increased demands on services and infrastructure. The Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 is amended to provide annual grants to Guam, Hawaii, Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa for health, education, social, and public safety services or infrastructure related to such services. The grants are awarded and administered by the Department of the Interior, Office of Insular Affairs, and must be used for specified purposes. The Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 is amended to provide annual grants to Guam, Hawaii, Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa for services or infrastructure related to qualified nonimmigrants. The Secretary of the Interior will conduct periodic enumerations of qualified nonimmigrants in these areas, at least once every five years. The Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 is amended to provide annual grants to Guam, Hawaii, Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa for services or infrastructure related to qualified nonimmigrants. The Secretary of the Interior will conduct periodic enumerations of qualified nonimmigrants in these areas, supervised by the United States Bureau of the Census or another selected organization. Grants will be allocated based on the number of qualified immigrants in each jurisdiction. The Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 is amended to provide annual grants to Guam, Hawaii, Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa for services or infrastructure related to qualified nonimmigrants. The Secretary of the Interior will conduct periodic enumerations of qualified nonimmigrants in these areas, supervised by the United States Bureau of the Census or another selected organization. Grants will be allocated based on the number of qualified immigrants in each jurisdiction, including the treatment of certain health care impact costs for medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 is amended to provide annual grants to Guam, Hawaii, Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa for services or infrastructure related to qualified nonimmigrants. The term 'qualified nonimmigrant' refers to individuals admitted to the US under specific sections of the Compact of Free Association. These individuals are eligible for medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act, with payments not affecting any limitations under section 1108. The Compact of Free Association Act of 1985 is amended to include medical assistance for individuals from Palau under section 141. The effective date for this amendment is for medical services provided during or after fiscal year 2012.
